messages.subject: The power of knowing you have a choice
messages.msgSnippet: There is a July 20 blog post by a mom named Sarah, who has written about how a day was changed, by the way a life is being changed. She writing about seeing
messages.messageBody:
There is a July 20 blog post by a mom named Sarah, who has written
about how a day was changed, by the way a life is being changed. She
writing about seeing choices. I don't want to give away the joy and
the details, but it's very nicely written and was wonderfully done.

http://unprocessedfamily.blogspot.com/2012/07/turning-day-around.html

I'm going to reveal part (not all) of the ending, just in case someone
is wondering whether it's worth reading. Looking back on the day
she's described, she wrote:


"If I'd stayed on my path that I started on, my kids would have felt
like a bother, a pain, a grudging responsibility. One of them for sure
would have felt unloved. Another would have closed me out. The other
two would have just gotten crankier and crankier as the emotional
undercurrent they didn't understand got yuckier. Instead, every one of
my kids went to sleep feeling loved and like they'd lived the day all
the way through."

I'm glad Sarah has written and shared that.

Sandra




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
